name: randomly

C1 in a way that happens, is done, or is chosen by chance rather than according to a plan: The books were randomly arranged on the shelves. Interviewees were chosen randomly.
informal in a way that is unexpected or does not seem to have any reason or cause: He just randomly shouts stuff. See
random
More examplesFewer examplesThe candidates were randomly selected by a computer.Participants were randomly assigned to one of three treatments.randomly generated email addressesHe would randomly show up at my house at 7 a.m.You can't just randomly take things that don't belong to you.
